title: Composite likelihood estimation of stationary Gaussian processes with a view toward stochastic volatility
abstract: arXiv:2403.12653v1 Announce Type: new  Abstract: We develop a framework for composite likelihood inference of parametric continuous-time stationary Gaussian processes. We derive the asymptotic theory of the associated maximum composite likelihood estimator. We implement our approach on a pair of models that has been proposed to describe the random log-spot variance of financial asset returns. A simulation study shows that it delivers good performance in these settings and improves upon a method-of-moments estimation. In an application, we inspect the dynamic of an intraday measure of spot variance computed with high-frequency data from the cryptocurrency market. The empirical evidence supports a mechanism, where the short- and long-term correlation structure of stochastic volatility are decoupled in order to capture its properties at different time scales.

translated_title: 复合似然估计在稳态高斯过程中的应用并针对随机波动性进行研究
translated_abstract: 我们开发了一个框架，用于对参数化连续时间稳态高斯过程进行复合似然推断。我们推导了相关最大复合似然估计器的渐近理论。我们将我们的方法应用于一对旨在描述金融资产回报的随机对数现货波动性的模型。模拟研究表明，在这些情景下，它表现良好，并改善了矩法估计方法。在应用中，我们研究了利用加密货币市场高频数据计算的一种日内度量的动态特性。经验证据支持一种机制，在这种机制中，随机波动性的短期和长期相关结构是分开的，以捕捉其在不同时间尺度上的特性。
tldr: 开发了复合似然推断框架，用于稳态高斯过程的参数估计，成功改善了矩法估计方法，实证结果支持随机波动性在不同时间尺度上的特性
en_tdlr: Developed a framework for composite likelihood inference of parametric continuous-time stationary Gaussian processes, successfully improving upon method-of-moments estimation, with empirical evidence supporting the characteristics of stochastic volatility at different time scales.
